instructions:
You are about to start the "Keyboarding" test.

When the test begins, you will see an editing window. Type the text in the same format as it appears in the document mentioned on the left. The text you type will word-wrap (move to the next line automatically).

Continue typing for the full test duration. Your score will be based on the time allowed for the test.

While you may use the Backspace key to correct errors, you will not receive credit for the Backspace keystrokes.

Unless otherwise instructed, you will be allowed five minutes to complete this test. The time will begin with your first keystroke. You will notice a countdown timer on the header section showing the time remaining.

questions.referenceText:
REQUESTS FOR PRODUCTION

1.  If you contend that the injuries received in the accident by plaintiff caused loss of income to plaintiff, provide all documents created since 1998 constituting, containing, or responding or referring to any job applications submitted or received by plaintiff, employment contracts obtained by plaintiff, sales contracts, requests by plaintiff for promotions or job transfers, or promotions, firings, demotions, or job transfers of plaintiff, or documents reflecting the employment by plaintiff of another or others to perform tasks which, but for injuries incurred in the accident, would have been performed by plaintiff.

2.  If you contend that the injuries received in the accident by plaintiff caused economic loss to plaintiff, provide all state and federal tax returns, if any, filed by plaintiff since January 1, 1988.

3.  Provide all documents referring to, describing, depicting, reporting, or created and obtained in connection with any collision or other event that resulted in any damage whatsoever to any vehicle owned or operated by plaintiff.  These documents shall include, but not be limited to, police reports and photographs, accident reports, insurance claims, adjusters' estimates, repair estimates, and cancelled checks.

4.  Provide all photographs, videotapes, drawings, diagrams, sketches, and other documents created after the accident and depicting, describing, or purporting to depict or describe any part of the accident scene, the Smith vehicle, any component part of the Smith vehicle, the Jones vehicle, and any component part of the Jones vehicle.

5.  Provide all recorded statements, written statements, and summaries of statements made by any party or witness about the accident, about the events causing the accident, or about injuries caused by or resulting from the accident.

6.  Provide all photographs, videotapes, films, recordings, or other documents containing, comprising, referring to, reporting on, or recording comments that relate to the accident or to any injuries received by any person involved in the accident.  This request includes videotapes of television appearances, recordings or transcripts of radio broadcasts, and newspaper articles or other articles.

7.  Provide all documents referring to, describing, reporting, recording, analyzing, or opining on the accident or any event, act, omission, or condition that caused or contributed to causing the accident.

8.  Provide all reports, summaries, or descriptions of, and documents authorizing, referring to, drawing conclusions from, making recommendations based on all or part of, or created or obtained in connection with, any investigation of the accident conducted by or at the request of any law enforcement agency or any other federal, state, or local government agencies.

9.  Provide all reports, summaries, or descriptions of, and documents authorizing, referring to, drawing conclusions from, making recommendations based on all or a part of, or created or obtained in connection with, any non-governmental, private, or unofficial investigation of the accident.  This request includes, but should not be limited to, investigations conducted by any insurance company.

10.  Provide all documents constituting, referring to, describing the results of, or created or obtained in connection with any blood-alcohol or any other test conducted within 12 hours to determine the drug or substance content or level of plaintiff.

11.  Provide all documents describing, referring to, recording the results of, or created or obtained in connection with any inspection, measurement, investigation, or examination of the accident scene.

12.  Provide all documents describing, referring to, or depicting the speed or velocity, or the position on the roadway of the Smith vehicle at any time during the accident or within one minute before or after the accident.

13.  Provide all documents describing, referring to, or depicting the speed or velocity, or the position on the roadway of the Jones vehicle at any time during the accident or within one minute before or after the accident.

14.  Provide all documents describing, referring to, depicting, recording, analyzing, or opining on the angle at which the Jones vehicle first struck the Smith vehicle.
